Internet Safety & Online Communication

Master the essentials for staying safe online and communicating confidently and responsibly in the digital world.

1. Online Safety Basics ▶

  • Why is Internet Safety Important? ▶
    • Threats on the internet include viruses, malware, scams, identity theft, and cyberbullying. Practicing internet safety helps protect your personal data, devices, and reputation from such digital dangers. It also prevents financial loss and emotional distress.
  • Creating Strong Passwords ▶
    • Use at least 8 characters with upper/lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols. Avoid obvious choices like names, birthdays, or "password." Change passwords regularly and use different passwords for different sites. Consider a trusted password manager.
  • Identifying Safe Websites ▶
    • Check for "https://" in the URL, a padlock symbol, and well-known domains. Be cautious of popups, misspellings, or requests for personal info. Do not download files from unknown sources.

2. Cyber Threats & Safe Practices ▶

  • Phishing & Scams ▶
    • Phishing involves fake emails or websites try to trick you into giving up passwords, bank details, or confidential info. Always check the sender, don’t click on suspicious links, and never share private details with untrusted contacts.
  • Secure Browsing & Devices ▶
    • Regularly update your browser and antivirus. Log out of websites after use. Avoid using public WiFi for sensitive transactions. Use two-factor authentication when possible.
  • Protecting Personal Info ▶
    • Don't overshare personal images or location online, particularly on social media. Use privacy settings and be conscious of your digital footprint.
What is phishing?

3. Responsible Online Communication ▶

  • Netiquette & Respect ▶
    • Always be polite online, whether posting publicly or chatting privately. Avoid using all-caps (it means "shouting"), respect opinions, and never bully, threat or harass others.
  • Privacy in Messaging & Social Media ▶
    • Set your social media posts and groups to “private” or “friends only.” Never publish sensitive information in public spaces.
  • Verifying Information ▶
    • Before sharing articles or images, make sure they're accurate and not fake news or misleading. Use reliable news sites and fact-checking tools.
